thread.title: Former Paul aides Jesse Benton and John Tate retake helm at pro-Rand super PAC
thread.title_full: Former Paul aides Jesse Benton and John Tate retake helm at pro-Rand super PAC - POLITICO

author: Michael Kruse
title: Former Paul aides Jesse Benton and John Tate retake helm at pro-Rand super PAC
text:
Jesse Benton and John Tate, who both took a leave of absence from running the primary pro-Rand Paul super PAC, have returned to lead the fundraising group after being acquitted of charges they faced in a campaign fraud case dating to 2012. Benton was acquitted of the final charge he faced on Thursday. Earlier in the month, a judge tossed all four of the other charges he faced. Both Benton and Tate are former longtime aides to former Rep. Ron Paul and Sen. Rand Paul. Benton had been serving as a general consultant to the super PAC, America's Liberty, and Tate had served as president and founder.
When the two Republican operatives were charged, they took a leave of absence from America's Liberty and John McCardell, the vice president of finance, took over in the interim.
McCardell said both Tate and Benton have "resumed their original roles."
"They are both back to helping America's Liberty PAC and Rand Paul full-time now," McCardell told POLITICO in an email.
McCardell also said he is back to his previous role as vice president of finance.
